current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the provision of performance awards to employees of the Internal Revenue Service who
			 owe back taxes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: No Bonuses for Tax-Delinquent IRS Employees Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: No Bonuses for Tax-Delinquent IRS Employees Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Prohibition on performance awards to IRS employees who owe back taxes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not provide any performance award
			 (including, but not limited to, bonuses, step increases, and time off) to
			 an employee of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
who owes an outstanding
			 Federal tax debt.

quote.#tail: means any outstanding debt under the

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
which has not been paid after
			 an assessment of a tax, penalty, or interest and which is not subject to
			 further appeal or a petition for redetermination under such Code. A debt
			 shall not fail to be treated as an outstanding Federal tax debt merely
			 because it is the subject of an installment agreement under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2282 IS: No Bonuses for Tax-Delinquent IRS Employees Act of 2014
